location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 245 of 1827 from William Newnham, Secretary to the Governor of Bombay, Bombay Castle, to the Resident in the Persian Gulf at Bushire [Ephraim Gerrish Stannus]

mods.abstract: William Newnham transmits a translated letter from Sooltan bin Suggur [Sulṭān bin Ṣaqr Āl Qāsimī, ruler of Sharjah], dated 8 December 1826, complaining of the violence and oppression of his neighbours and of the instructions communicated to the Persian secretary. Newnham informs the Resident that the Governor of Bombay will be happy to receive his report.Enclosures:Substance of a letter from Sooltan bin Suggur to the Honourable the Governor, dated 8 Jumadyoolawul [Jumādá I 1242] or 8 December 1826;Copy of letter no. 244 from William Newnham to the Persian Secretary, dated 21 February 1827;Copy of a letter from the Honourable the Governor to Sooltan bin Suggur, dated 3 March 1827.
